title: Cramér–von Mises criterion
summary: In statistics the Cramér–von Mises criterion is a criterion used for judging the goodness of fit of a cumulative distribution function F ∗ {\displaystyle F^{*}} compared to a given empirical distribution function F n {\displaystyle F_{n}} , or for comparing two empirical distributions.  It is also used as a part of other algorithms, such as minimum distance estimation.  It is defined as
